column2: Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string behave unexpectedly.
column4: The escape sequence '\s' is equivalent to just 's', so the sequence is not a character class when it is used in a [["regular expression"|"relative:///editormd.amd.js:3897:44:3897:105"]].

column2: Regular expressions without anchors can be vulnerable to bypassing.
column4: Misleading operator precedence. The subexpression '^[0-9a-f]{6}' is anchored at the beginning, but the other parts of this regular expression are not
